A certain electrical appliance is powered from a mains supply. The appliance normally uses a
current of 3A, but the current briefly rises to 4A at the instant the appliance is switched on. The
cable to the appliance is designed for currents up to 6A.

The fuses available to protect the cable are rated at 1A, 3A, 5A and 13A.

Which fuse should be used?

A 1A B 3A C 5A D 13A

B
